description: Borrowing from Late Latin superficiālis (“of or belonging to the surface”), from superficiēs (“top, surface”) +‎ -ālis (“-al”, adjectival suffix).

adjectives.description: superficial (comparative more superficial, superlative most superficial)

definitionGroups.group: (relational) Existing, occurring, or located on the surface.

entries.meaning: (anatomy, relational) Situated or occurring on the skin or immediately beneath it.
Appearing to be true or real only until examined more closely.

definitionGroups.group: Not thorough, deep, or complete; concerned only with the obvious or apparent.

entries.meaning: ​Lacking depth of character or understanding; lacking substance or significance.
(rare) Two-dimensional; drawn on a flat surface.
(Britain, architecture) Denoting a quantity of a material expressed in terms of area covered rather than linear dimension or volume.
(usually in the plural) A surface detail.
examples: He always concentrates on the superficials and fails to see the real issue.
